title: What do modern Hungarians think of Imre Nagy? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a 1956 freedom fighter, I consider Imre Nagy one of the prominent leaders of Hungarian history, a hero of the revolution and fight for our independence. He courageously took our country out of the Soviet Warsaw Pact and suffered execution by the re-invading Soviets and their newly installed government who crushed our freedom and forced me and others to become political refugees.
He was a hero who stood up to the Russians during 1956 revolution.When they retook Budapest he was executed by the soviets. He is in Hungary regarded as a hero
